alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Henry; Louisa (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 6:15AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Henderson, Warren, northern McDonough, southern Mercer, northeastern Henry, Des Moines and southern Louisa Counties through 715 AM CDT... At 615 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Joy to near Oakville to New London. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Burlington, Monmouth, Aledo, Wapello, Oquawka, Burgess, Mediapolis, Winfield, Roseville, Stronghurst, Morning Sun, Kirkwood, New Boston, Keithsburg, Joy, Little York, Biggsville, Gladstone, Rozetta and Seaton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
